intro: Mesembryanthemum bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus's ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the cooler months. It is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Mesembryanthemum bolusii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
